DEFINITION: Sample collected using an automated sampler
A specimen consisting of all or part of a biological organism, including flora or fauna
Long cylindrical cores
Half-cylindrical products of along-axis split of a whole round
Material occurring between unambiguous [as curated] breaks in recovery
Quarter-cylindrical products of along-axis split of a half round
Arbitrarily cut segments of a "core"
Half-cylindrical products of along-axis split of a section or its component fragments through a selected diameter
Unambiguously mated portion of a larger piece noted for curatorial management of the material
Cylindrical segments of core or core section material
Loose, coarse, unconsolidated material suspended in drilling fluid
A group of rocks collected by dragging a dredge along the seafloor
Sample that consists of a digestion of plant foliage
Sample that consists of leachate from foliage
Sample that consists of a digestion of forest floor material
A sample (sometimes mechanically collected) from a deposit or area, not intended to be representative of the deposit or area
A sample that is an individual unit, including rock hand samples, a biological specimen, or a bottle of fluid
Sample that consists of a digestion of litter fall
Core that can be positioned on the surface in the same way that it was arranged in the borehole before extraction
Sample does not fit any of the existing type designations. It is expected that further detailed description of the particular sample be provided
Sample from dry deposition in a petri dish
Sample from bulk precipitation
A sample created from pulverizing a rock to powder
Standard reference specimen
A sample of a section of the near-surface Earth, generally in the critical zone
The specimen type is unknown
Thin section
